item.title: मञ्जुश्रीः २०२१
item.description: Source: TW On patanjali Primary text: Yoga-sūtra-s of Patanjali Etymological derivation of “patañjali” (folk): patat/patitā (to fall) + añjali (hollowing of the palms) - patañjaliriti patati sma añjalerityarthaḥ = he who “fell into the folded/cupped hands” (of Goņikā] Acc. to Pt. Ram Shankar Bhattacharya, Patanjali is the name of a gotra Cidambara-mahatmya: an important source of the sacred narrative of Patanjali. Acc to this, Adisesa manifests himself as Patanjali (a half-human, half-serpent form) by falling into the cupped hands (añjali) of Anasuyā to witness Siva’s ananda-tandava.
